attributes.action: Re-issue 2020 grades so that lowered grades are in line with teacher predictions
attributes.additional_details: This will ensure all students across the UK have access to the same level playing field. It will ensure fairness despite the pandemic. It is not appropriate or in order to treat students as statistics, forgetting that students are individuals. All students must be able to progress despite the prior attainment of their school or their ‘postcodes’. All lowered grades should and must re-issued. The statistical modelling used in not ethically sound during a global pandemic.
attributes.background:
Withdraw all 2020 grades that are based on statistical modelling, and re-issue grades based on the professional judgements of teachers as provided in the ‘Centre Assessment Grades’.
This ensures that pupils are treated as individuals and that each individual is able to progress despite COVID-19.

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition, the Government has announced that GCSE and A-level students will be given their Centre Assessment Grades (CAGs). 

You may wish to sign one or more of the following petitions which call for actions relating to this issue:

Allow free and accessible appeals of GCSE and A Level calculated grades: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334013

Review the decision to use previous data to calculate exam grades: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306773

Review the standardisation of grades so state school pupils aren't disadvantaged: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325422

Work with regulators and exam providers to clarify exam arrangements for 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312570

https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
